qas.question: In what country was a full-scale working railway steam locomotive first invented?
On what date did the first railway trip in the world occur?
Where did the world's first railway journey terminate?
In what constituent country of the United Kingdom is Merthyr Tydfil located?
In what geographical portion of Wales is Abercynon located?
In what country was a full-scale working railway steam centre first invented?
On what date did the first railway trip in England occur?
Where did the England's first railway journey terminate?
In what constituent country of the United Kingdom is Trevithick located?
In what geographical portion of England is Abercynon located?

context: The first full-scale working railway steam locomotive was built by Richard Trevithick in the <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>United Kingdom<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> and, on <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>21 February 1804<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, the world's first railway journey took place as Trevithick's unnamed steam locomotive hauled a train along the tramway from the Pen-y-darren ironworks, near Merthyr Tydfil to <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>Abercynon<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_0/> in <a3_1><a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>south<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> <a3_0><a3_2><b8_0>Wales<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/><a2_1/>. The design incorporated a number of important innovations that included using high-pressure steam which reduced the weight of the engine and increased its efficiency. Trevithick visited the Newcastle area later in 1804 and the colliery railways in north-east England became the leading centre for experimentation and development of steam locomotives.
